meanings.definition: Have an angry argument or disagreement.
meanings.sent1: The siblings quarrelled over who gets to sit in the front seat.
meanings.sent2: They often quarrelled about which TV show to watch.
meanings.sent3: The two friends quarrelled playfully over the last slice of pizza.
meanings.sent4: The neighbors quarrelled like thunder and lightning during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The birds outside quarrelled loudly, disturbing the peace of the morning.

meanings.definition: Engage in a heated dispute or altercation.
meanings.sent1: The team quarrelled over the best strategy to win the game.
meanings.sent2: The politicians quarrelled during the debate, trying to prove their points.
meanings.sent3: The kids quarrelled noisily over who gets to be the captain of the ship.
meanings.sent4: The clouds quarrelled in the sky, creating a dramatic scene before the rain.
meanings.sent5: The waves quarrelled with the shore, crashing against the rocks in a fierce battle.
